recipe_name: Boiled egg with rye bread soldiers
author: Justine Pattison
method: Half fill a medium saucepan with water and bring to the boil. Gently add the eggs to the water with a slotted spoon and return to the boil. Cook the eggs in the boiling water for 6 minutes for a soft-boiled egg.  While the eggs are cooking, toast the bread, spread it with a thin layer of butter and cut into thin soldiers.  Put the eggs in egg cups and place on small plates. Cut off the tops and season to taste. Serve with the soldiers for dipping.
ingredients: 2 medium eggs,  2 slices dark rye bread (pumpernickel),  5g unsalted butter, for spreading,  sea salt and ground black pepper
